trans-unit.source: '{0}' will throw for assemblies embedded in a single-file app
trans-unit.target: '{0}' will throw for assemblies embedded in a single-file app

trans-unit.source: Avoid accessing Assembly file path when publishing as a single file
trans-unit.target: Avoid accessing Assembly file path when publishing as a single file

trans-unit.source: '{0}' always returns an empty string for assemblies embedded in a single-file app. If the path to the app directory is needed, consider calling 'System.AppContext.BaseDirectory'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' always returns an empty string for assemblies embedded in a single-file app. If the path to the app directory is needed, consider calling 'System.AppContext.BaseDirectory'.

trans-unit.source: Avoid accessing Assembly file path when publishing as a single file
trans-unit.target: Avoid accessing Assembly file path when publishing as a single file

trans-unit.source: Using member '{0}' which has 'RequiresAssemblyFilesAttribute' can break functionality when embedded in a single-file app.{1}{2}
trans-unit.target: Using member '{0}' which has 'RequiresAssemblyFilesAttribute' can break functionality when embedded in a single-file app.{1}{2}

trans-unit.source: Avoid calling members marked with 'RequiresAssemblyFilesAttribute' when publishing as a single-file
trans-unit.target: Avoid calling members marked with 'RequiresAssemblyFilesAttribute' when publishing as a single-file

trans-unit.source: Using method '{0}' which has 'RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute' can break functionality when trimming application code. {1}. {2}
trans-unit.target: Using method '{0}' which has 'RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute' can break functionality when trimming application code. {1}. {2}

trans-unit.source: Methods annotated with 'RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute' require dynamic access otherwise can break functionality when trimming application code
trans-unit.target: Methods annotated with 'RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute' require dynamic access otherwise can break functionality when trimming application code
